intro: Alchemilla melancholica, commonly known as the melancholy plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, spreading habit. The plant features basal leaves that are softly hairy and have a distinctive silvery underside. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and appear in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Alchemilla melancholica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
